result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin J DeGroot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA waived based on date of violation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Advanced Auto Parts.
Restitution set at ZERO. (paid prior to sentencing)

timeConds.notes: Perform 100 hours as a a Condition of Probation (50 hours per year of probation)

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Consecutive to: count 1 and any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. (DNA waived based on date of violation)

timeConds.notes: Condition Time (nonworking hours) With Huber. Report by 2/08/16 by 5pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Devin J DeGroot in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek is requesting an adjournment of the trial and advises the Court the charges is being amended to a misdemeanor with upfront payment of restitution.   The Defendant has paid upfront restitution but still owes an additional small amount.  The Court cancels the trial and set the matter accordingly.
